snippet: At one point, <MONEY>$50 billion</MONEY> in federal loan guarantees were meant to cover nuclear projects, but a plant in <LOCATION>Georgia</LOCATION> may receive the only guarantees made.
abstract: Energy <PERSON>Sec Ernest Moniz</PERSON> is set to announce that he will finish a <MONEY>$6.5 billion</MONEY> loan guarantee and another soon for <MONEY>$1.8 billion</MONEY> to help three <LOCATION>Georgia</LOCATION> electric companies build first new nuclear reactors in <LOCATION>United States</LOCATION> in three decades; announcement comes far later than anticipated and may effectively end loan program established in <DATE>2005</DATE> by <ORGANIZATION>Congress</ORGANIZATION>, which at one point had promised to support <MONEY>$50 billion</MONEY> in loans for nuclear projects.
lead_paragraph: At one point, <MONEY>$50 billion</MONEY> in federal loan guarantees were meant to cover nuclear projects, but a plant in <LOCATION>Georgia</LOCATION> may receive the only guarantees made.
headline: {main:Loan Program Reactors Is Fizzling,print_headline:Loan Program Reactors Is Fizzling}

snippet: The tax-free status municipal bonds appealing year, tax rules effect.
abstract: Municipal bonds have been depressed, but their tax-free status is likely to become even more appealing in <DATE>2014</DATE>, as new tax rules go into effect; munis are seen as especially good for well-off people past 70 1/2, who are required to take minimum distributions from their retirement plans.
lead_paragraph: The tax-free status municipal bonds appealing year, tax rules effect.
headline: {main:After Setbacks, Municipal Bond Sector Is Looking Up,print_headline:After Setbacks, Municipal Bond Sector Is Looking Up}
